title: SS.PT.472
prompt: How does this excerpt reflect the ideas and actions that led to the American Revolution?
description:
The following excerpt from Thomas Jefferson was written when he lived in Europe while serving as Secretary of State under George Washington.

“I was much an enemy to monarchies before I came to Europe. I am ten thousand times more so, since I have seen what they are. There is scarcely an evil known in these countries, which may not be traced to their king, as its source, nor a good, which is not derived from the small fibres of republicanism existing among them.”

Thomas Jefferson, letter to General Washington, May 2, 1788
feedback: Thomas Jefferson wrote the Declaration of Independence which lists all the “evils” King George had committed against the colonies and started the American Revolution. The idea that monarchies are unfair is restated in Jefferson’s letter to Washington and the idea that republican governments could survive started to take hold across Europe, starting in 1789 with the French Revolution.
